com.coyote.drinknomore.fixture

Class DataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coyote.drinknomore.fixture.DataManager

  • public class DataManager
extends java.lang.Object
    DataManager. This class is an "orm-like" manager which simplifies insertion in database with sqlite adapters.

    • Method Detail

      • persist

        public int persist(java.lang.Object object)
        Tells the ObjectManager to make an instance managed and persistent. The object will be entered into the database as a result of the flush operation. NOTE: The persist operation always considers objects that are not yet known to this ObjectManager as NEW. Do not pass detached objects to the persist operation.
        Parameters:
        object - $object The instance to make managed and persistent.
        Returns:
        Count of objects entered into the DB

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.Object object)
        Removes an object instance. A removed object will be removed from the database as a result of the flush operation.
        Parameters:
        object - $object The object instance to remove.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes all changes to objects that have been queued up to now to the database. This effectively synchronizes the in-memory state of managed objects with the database.

      • getRepository

        public SQLiteAdapterBase<?> getRepository(java.lang.String className)
        Gets the repository for a class.
        Parameters:
        className - $className
        Returns:
        \Doctrine\Common\Persistence\ObjectRepository

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.Object object)
        Check if the object is part of the current UnitOfWork and therefore managed.
        Parameters:
        object - $object
        Returns:
        bool
